data.author: Chris Lalancette
data.message:
Switch robot_localization to modern CMake idioms. (#895)

Some of these have been best practice for a while, and
some of them will become best practice in the near future.

1. Move the include directory down one-level.  This is to better
support overlays and underlays; see https://github.com/ros2/ros2/issues/1150
for the entire saga.  The upshot is that all includes should be
one more directory level down, and CMake will handle the differences.
This has been best practice since Humble.

2. Switch from ament_target_dependencies() to target_link_libraries().
ament_target_dependencies was developed in the days before
target_link_libraries() was fully capable, and nowadays
target_link_libraries() is a superset of the functionality.  There is
one oddity here, in that in order to deal with ROS message packages, we
have to use ${<msg_pkg_name>_TARGETS}, rather than the traditional CMake
target like msg_pkg_name::msg_pkg_name.  This is a bug in ROS that will
eventually be fixed.

3. Export a CMake target from robot_localization.  This means that
downstream packages will be able to use
target_link_libraries(<target> robot_localization::robot_localization)

4. Export all dependencies with ament_export_dependencies.  This ensures
that downstream project which rely on this one will be able to find
all of the includes.

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@gmail.com>

data.author: Chris Lalancette
data.message:
Fix warnings when building against Rolling. (#896)

Rolling has moved header files (deprecating the old one),
and changed the preferred form of some templated classes (like
TimeSynchronizer).  Fix those warnings here.

Note that this should *only* be applied for Rolling, as it will
fail to compile for earlier versions of ROS 2.

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@gmail.com>

data.author: Jacob Perron
data.message:
Fix runtime exception thrown when parameter override not provided (#675)

The templated declare_parameter method needs an override (or default value) since
it returns the actual parameter value, otherwise we get an exception.
To correctly declare a parameter without a default value, we should use a different
signature.

Related upstream issue: https://github.com/ros2/rclcpp/issues/1691

Signed-off-by: Jacob Perron <jacob@openrobotics.org>

data.author: Jacob Perron
data.message:
Remove try-catch blocks around declare_parameter (#663)

Try-catches were added in https://github.com/cra-ros-pkg/robot_localization/pull/631 due to a new rclcpp feature enforcing static parameter.
The behavior was later patched for this particular use-case in https://github.com/ros2/rclcpp/pull/1673, so now we can avoid having to try-catch.

Signed-off-by: Jacob Perron <jacob@openrobotics.org>

If a default value is not provided, then we must specify the parameter type.

When there is a NoParameterOverrideProvided exception, the parameter
is not declared so we don't need to undeclare it.

data.author: Jacob Perron
data.message:
Expect bool return type for get_parameter calls (#638)

In some places, the code was expecting a PARAMETER_NOT_SET value from get_parameter
when actually a bool is being returned.

The code just happened to work before since PARAMETER_NOT_SET has value 0, which is
equivalent to false.

Signed-off-by: Jacob Perron <jacob@openrobotics.org>

data.author: Mabel Zhang
data.message:
Port to Dashing: melodic-devel 2.6.3 to current (#530)

* Fixing Euler body-to-world transformations

(cherry picked from commit 58bef056cf84856eb5e91a89f643017c448669ff)

* fix RLE/RLL tests

* Enabling the user to override the output child_frame_id

(cherry picked from commit f6421901c3da983c01c039c7dee6894340069883)

* Add const& to catch values to prevent the error:  catching polymorphic type ‘class tf2::TransformException’ by value
And ZoneNumber by 0x3fU to prevent error: directive output may be truncated writing between 1 and 11 bytes into a region of size 4

(cherry picked from commit c1963c34868af0d3d0699c0928fa2185fee72106)

* Rename odomBaseLinkTrans to baseLinkOdomTrans

Adhere to the naming convention <fromFrame><toFrame>Trans used for worldBaseLinkTrans and mapOdomTrans.

(cherry picked from commit 17d4f100a46e7fbed9c17c874f6f9baa3091f54f)

* Enable build optimisations if no build type configured.

The selected build type can have a significant influence on processor usage (tenths of %). As setting a build type is often forgotten by users, from-source builds of robot_localization on resource constraint platforms can run into issues of low update rates, starvation and issues with stability.

If a build type is configured (on the ROS buildfarm fi), the added stanzas respect it and do not overwrite it. If nothing is configured, a warning is printed and the CMake-standard `RelWithDebInfo` type is configured.

(cherry picked from commit cc93cef0405d5d9ac67aee3cc7af04f480fe599c)

* fix differential init typo, compiler warning

* Add broadcast_utm_transform_as_parent_frame

(cherry picked from commit e8deb5ded33a6f7ca014839151bb406cf9526f1a)

* Fixing title underline

(cherry picked from commit da80adf15c9079f0757825618755fd243e22eda8)

(cherry picked from commit 0d32daf42d4b019a2d180ac53e01582cf22165b7)

(cherry picked from commit e2f75c361ec78fa8a6bd4fd4f1d060ef6886bcad)

This is actually the frame_id of the information, not the 'gps' frame which might not even exist

data.author: Rein Appeldoorn
data.message:
feature(initialization): Initialization update for frames and parameters

In the constructor, the robot localization listener waits for incoming
message to initialize properly. This enables the exposition of the
getFrame id methods. Also added an additional parameter_namespace
parameter to refer to the robot localization instance so that the same
filter parameters can be used, this value defaults to ~ which implies
that we search in the local namespace.

data.author: Rein Appeldoorn
data.message:
refactor(robot_localization_listener): Remap arg to robot_localization instance

The parameter namespace of the listener is now by default 'robot_localization',
this parameter can be remapped to the running robot localization listener to
obtain the same parameters as the running robot localization instance.

data.author: Rein Appeldoorn
data.message:
fix(logging): Add 5.0 seconds delay and throttle if lookup fails

This will often go wrong since the odometry localization node is often
not initialized before the map localization node. This results in errors
on startup. Adding 5.0 delay gives the estimator time to properly
initialize.

data.message:
Merge pull request #348 from SGSSGene/issue/imutwistbasicio

fixes ukf IMUTwistBasicIO test

data.author: Simon Gene Gottlieb
data.message:
fixes ukf IMUTwistBasicIO test

the issue is that the way how a proper rotation was tested isn't
reliable. Because of gimble lock, similar rotation can have huge changes
in euler angle representation. This was an issue in IMUTwistBasicIO.

Instead of comparing Euler Angles, quaternion are being compared, making
the test much more reliable.

data.author: Rein Appeldoorn
data.message:
feature(navsat_transform): Parameter to publish "utm" as parent frame

In order to create a transformation tree with multiple robots, a common
parent frame is required. So far, it was only possible to publish "utm"
as child frame of the odometry frame. Adding this feature, the user can
specify whether to publish the "utm" transform as parent or child of the
odometry frame.

data.author: Ivor Wanders
data.message:
Add reporting of bad timestamps via diagnostics

The first situation which is reported is if the timestamp is before or equal to
 the timestamp of the last pose reset. This report is also triggered when the
 timestamp is empty (zero) since `lastSetPoseTime_` is also initialised to zero.

The second situation which is reported is when a message is received that has
 a timestamp prior to the last message received for that topic.

In both situations the behaviour of the filter is to disregard the message and
 reporting this via diagnostics should be useful.

This resolves #224.
